title: Woodworking Tools Quiz
description: Test your knowledge of traditional and modern woodworking tools. Can you identify these workshop essentials?

questions.question: Which woodworking joint features interlocking fan-shaped pins and tails, prized for its strength and beauty?
What is a coping saw used for?
options: Cutting intricate curves and shapes in wood

questions.question: Which woodworking tool is a rotating machine that spins wood while a cutter shapes it?
What is a jointer used for in woodworking?
options: Flattening one face and straightening one edge of a board

questions.question: Which hand tool has a flat steel blade in a wooden or metal body, used to smooth wood surfaces?
What is a biscuit joiner used for?
options: Cutting slots for oval wooden biscuits to align and join boards

questions.question: Which tool is a long bar with sliding jaws used to clamp boards together during glue-ups?
What is a spokeshave traditionally used for?
options: Shaping curved surfaces like chair legs and wheel spokes

questions.question: Which power tool machine holds wood in place and uses a vertical blade to cut precise, smooth boards to thickness?
What is a cabinet scraper used for?
options: Producing a smooth finish on wood by scraping thin shavings, finer than sandpaper

questions.question: Which measuring tool has a metal hook at the end and a retractable coiled tape?
What is a scroll saw designed to cut?
options: Intricate curves and detailed patterns in thin wood

questions.question: Which tool is a flat piece of flexible steel used to apply and smooth wood filler or veneer?
What is a doweling jig used for?
options: Guiding a drill to bore perfectly aligned holes for dowel joints

questions.question: Which adhesive is the most commonly used glue for woodworking joints?
